duties_responsibilities.duty: Assess the physical and psychosocial status of patients through interviews, health history, physical examination, and diagnostic tests.
Interpret patient data and develop and implement a plan of treatment.
Provide diagnosis and treatment of common acute illnesses and maintenance healthcare to patients with stable chronic illnesses.
Order appropriate diagnostic studies and discriminate between normal and abnormal findings.
Counsel patients on health maintenance and disease prevention, and provide health education.
Maintain accurate records, medication lists, and documentation of care for administrative purposes and reimbursement of services.
Supervise and intervene with clinical issues, support triage, and implement clinical education and training for clinical staff.
Prescribe within the practice agreement set forth by supervising physicians and ensure updated and accurate practice agreement every 2 years.
Maintain confidentiality of patient information and observe safety precautions and procedures in the performance of all duties to ensure a safe environment.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Current licensure as RN in the State of South Carolina; Certification by appropriate credentialing organization recognized by South Carolina as Nurse Practitioner; CPR, BLS.
